required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Antiviral Activity, Clinical Outcomes, Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of Orally Administered Lumicitabine (JNJ-64041575) Regimens in Hospitalized Infants and Children Aged 28 Days to 36 Months Infected With Respiratory Syncytial Virus
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Evaluate the Antiviral Activity, Clinical Outcomes, Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of Orally Administered Lumicitabine (JNJ-64041575) Regimens in Hospitalized Infants and Children Aged 28 Days to 36 Months Infected With Respiratory Syncytial Virus

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine in hospitalized infants and children who are infected with respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) the dose-response relationship of multiple regimens of lumicitabine on antiviral activity based on nasal RSV shedding using quantitative real-time reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR).

detailed_description.textblock: RSV is a leading cause of lower respiratory tract disease in infants. Most infants and children who get RSV recover fully after 1-2 weeks, but RSV infection can sometimes worsen and may lead to hospitalization and admission into an intensive care unit. The main purpose of this study is to learn how well the study drug (lumicitabine, also known as JNJ-64041575 or ALS-008176) works, how the human body handles the study drug, which dose of the study drug is effective for treatment of RSV infection in infants/children and how safe it is compared to a placebo (placebo looks just like lumicitabine [given in same way] but has no effect against RSV). Approximately up to 180 participants aged between 28 days to 36 months and hospitalized with RSV infection will take part in this world-wide study.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve (AUC) of Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV) Viral Load
primary_outcome.description: AUC of RSV viral load will be measured by quantitative reverse transcriptase -polymerase chain reaction (qRT-PCR) assay of midturbinate nasal swab.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
secondary_outcome.description: An adverse event is any untoward medical event that occurs in a participant administered an investigational product, and it does not necessarily indicate only events with clear causal relationship with the relevant investigational product.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Physical Examinations Abnormalities as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
secondary_outcome.description: Physical examination includes examination of all body systems (complete physical examination) and respiratory system, nose, ear, throat, facial and neck lymph nodes, and skin examination (directed physical examination).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Vital Sign/Peripheral Capillary Oxygen Saturation (SpO2) Abnormalities as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with vital signs (temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate and blood pressure) and SpO2 abnormalities will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Electrocardiogram (ECG) Abnormalities as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
secondary_outcome.description: A 12-lead ECG (where a 12-lead ECG is not possible or feasible, then a 6-lead ECG) will be performed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Laboratory Abnormalities as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples for hematology, biochemistry, and urinalysis will be collected at predefined time points for clinical laboratory testing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Time Curve (AUC) of JNJ-63549109 (Metabolite of Lumicitabine)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: 0.25 to 2 hours postdose; Day 2: 0.5 to 1 and 7 hours postdose; and Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: The AUC is the area under the plasma concentration time curve.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of JNJ-63549109 (Metabolite of Lumicitabine)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: 0.25 to 2 hours postdose; Day 2: 0.5 to 1 and 7 hours postdose; and Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: The Cmax is the maximum observed plasma concentration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Predicted Concentration of JNJ-63549109 (Metabolite of Lumicitabine) at 12 hours Postdose (C12h)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1: 0.25 to 2 hours postdose; Day 2: 0.5 to 1 and 7 hours postdose; and Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: C12h is the predicted concentration of JNJ-63549109 at 12 hours Postdose. C12h is model based prediction. It will be determined using a population pharmacokinetic (PK) model and based on the individual model predicted concentration time profiles.

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of Hospital Stay
secondary_outcome.description: The duration of hospitalization or length of hospital stay includes total days length of hospital stay from admission to discharge and to readiness for discharge (the time of enrollment up to the time the investigator determines that, based on the clinical status, the participant is ready to be discharged) and from study treatment initiation to discharge and to readiness for discharge (duration from the study treatment initiation up to the time the investigator determines that, based on the clinical status, the participant is ready to be discharged).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants who Require to be Admitted to Intensive Care Unit (ICU)
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of enrolled participants who require to be admitted to the ICU will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of ICU Stay
secondary_outcome.description: In the event that a participant require ICU, the duration for how long the participant remained in the ICU will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants who Require Supplemental Oxygen
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who require supplemental oxygen above pre-RSV infection status will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants who Require Non-invasive Mechanical Ventilation Support
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who require non-invasive mechanical ventilation support (that is, continuous positive airway pressure) above pre-RSV infection status will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants who Require Invasive Mechanical Ventilation Support
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who require invasive mechanical ventilation support (for example, endotracheal-mechanical ventilation or mechanical ventilation via tracheostomy) above pre-RSV infection status will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Supplemental Oxygen
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of supplemental oxygen above pre-RSV infection status will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Non-invasive Mechanical Ventilation Support
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of non-invasive mechanical ventilation support (that is, continuous positive airway pressure) to deliver oxygen above pre-RSV infection status will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Invasive Mechanical Ventilation Support
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of invasive mechanical ventilation support (for example, endotracheal-mechanical ventilation or mechanical ventilation via tracheostomy) to deliver oxygen above pre-RSV infection status will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to no Longer Requiring Supplemental Oxygen
secondary_outcome.description: Time to no longer requiring supplemental oxygen above pre-RSV infection status will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Clinical Stability
secondary_outcome.description: Time to clinical stability is defined as the time at which the following criteria are all met: normalization of blood oxygen level (return to baseline, by pulse oximetry) without requirement of supplemental oxygen beyond baseline level, normalization of oral feeding, normalization of respiratory rate, and normalization of heart rate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time From Initiation of Study Treatment Until Peripheral Capillary Oxygen Saturation (SpO2) Greater Than or Equal to (>=)93 Percent (%) on Room Air Among Participants who Were not on Supplemental Oxygen Prior to Onset of Respiratory Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Time (in hours) from initiation of study treatment until SpO2 >=93% on room air among participants who were not on supplemental oxygen prior to the onset of respiratory symptoms will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time for Respiratory Rate to Return to Pre-RSV Infection Status
secondary_outcome.description: Time for respiratory rate to return to pre-RSV infection status will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time for SpO2 to Return to Pre-RSV Infection Status
secondary_outcome.description: Time for SpO2 to return to pre-RSV infection status will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time for Body Temperature to Return To Pre-RSV Infection Status
secondary_outcome.description: Time for body temperature to return to pre-RSV infection status will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Acute Otitis Media
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with acute otitis media will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Signs and Symptoms of RSV Infection
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of signs and symptoms of RSV infection will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Severity of Signs and Symptoms of RSV Infection Assessed by the Pediatric RSV Electronic Severity and Outcome Rating System (PRESORS)
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of signs and symptoms of RSV infection will be assessed by the PRESORS. PRESORS questions will be answered by means of the following response scale: a lot less than usual, a little less than usual, about as much as usual, a little more than usual, a lot more than usual.

secondary_outcome.measure: RSV Viral Load Over Time
secondary_outcome.description: RSV viral load over time will be measured by qRT-PCR in the mid-turbinate nasal swab specimens.

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak Viral Load
secondary_outcome.description: Peak viral load will be measured by qRT-PCR in the mid-turbinate nasal swab specimens.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time To Peak Viral Load
secondary_outcome.description: Time to peak viral load will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Decline of Viral Load
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of decline in viral load during treatment as measured by qRT-PCR will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to RSV Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) Being Undetectable
secondary_outcome.description: Time to RSV RNA being undetectable (the time from initiation of study treatment until the time at which it is observed that the virus is undetectable in an assessment and after which time no virus positive assessment follows) will be assessed as measured by qRT-PCR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Undetectable RSV Viral Load
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with undetectable viral load will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of RSV RNA Viral Load From Baseline up to Day 10
secondary_outcome.description: RSV RNA viral load will be measured in midturbinate nasal swabs and in endotracheal samples.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of RSV RNA Viral Load From Baseline up to Day 14
secondary_outcome.description: RSV RNA viral load will be measured in midturbinate nasal swabs and in endotracheal samples.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of RSV Viral Load From Baseline Until 1 day (+2 Days) After the Last Dose of Study Drug
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline Until 1 day (+2 Days) After the Last Dose of Study Drug (approximately up to 10 days)
secondary_outcome.description: RSV viral load will be measured in midturbinate nasal swabs and in endotracheal samples.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Postbaseline Changes in the RSV Polymerase L-gene and Other Regions of the RSV Genome Compared With Baseline Sequences
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants will be assessed for changes in the RSV polymerase L-gene (only if no mutations are seen in the L-gene) and other regions of the RSV genome compared with baseline sequences.

secondary_outcome.measure: Acceptability of the Lumicitabine Formulation as Assessed by Parent(s)/Caregiver(s) electronic clinical outcome assessment (eCOA)
secondary_outcome.description: Acceptability of the lumicitabine formulation will be assessed by parent(s)/caregiver(s) eCOA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Palatability of the Lumicitabine Formulation as Assessed by Parent(s)/Caregiver(s) eCOA
secondary_outcome.description: Palatability (taste and texture) of the lumicitabine formulation will be assessed by parent(s)/caregiver(s) eCOA.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive a single 40 milligram per kilogram (mg/kg) loading dose (LD) (Dose 1) followed by nine 20 mg/kg maintenance doses (MDs) (Doses 2 to 10) of lumicitabine twice daily up to Day 5/6.
Participants will receive a single 60 mg/kg LD (Dose 1) followed by nine 40 mg/kg MDs (Doses 2 to 10) of lumicitabine twice daily up to Day 5/6.

Participants will receive either a single 40 mg/kg placebo LD (Dose 1) followed by nine 20 mg/kg maintenance dose (MDs) (Doses 2 to 10) of placebo twice daily or single 60 mg/kg placebo LD (Dose 1) followed by nine 40 mg/kg placebo MDs (Doses 2 to 10), twice daily up to Day 5/6.

intervention.description: Participants will receive oral administration of lumicitabine in Regimen A and Regimen B.
Participants will receive oral administration of matching placebo in Regimen C.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants hospitalized (or in emergency room [ER]) at the time of randomization and unlikely to be discharged for the first 24 hours after randomization
- Participants diagnosed with respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) infection using a polymerase chain reaction (PCR)-based molecular diagnostic assay, with or without co-infection with another respiratory pathogen (respiratory virus or bacteria)
- Participants who have an acute respiratory illness with signs and symptoms consistent with a viral infection (for example, fever, cough, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat, myalgia, lethargy, shortness of breath, or wheezing) with onset less than or equal to <=5 days from the anticipated time of randomization. Onset of symptoms is defined as the first time (within 1 hour) the parent(s)/caregiver(s) becomes aware of respiratory or systemic symptoms of RSV infection
- With the exception of the symptoms related to the RSV infection or defined comorbid condition for severe RSV disease (prematurity at birth [participant's gestational age was less than {<}37 weeks; for infants <1 year old at randomization], bronchopulmonary dysplasia, congenital heart disease, other congenital diseases, Down syndrome, neuromuscular impairment, or cystic fibrosis), participant must be medically stable on the basis of physical examination, medical history, vital signs/peripheral capillary oxygen saturation (SpO2), and electrocardiogram (ECG) performed at screening. If there are abnormalities, they must be consistent with the underlying condition in the study population and/or the RSV infection. This determination must be recorded in the participant's source documents and initialed by the investigator. Participants with comorbidities will be allowed to be enrolled once the Independent Data Monitoring Committee (IDMC) has reviewed the pharmacokinetic (PK) and safety data of the highest dose that will be used in this study and once the IDMC has recommended opening recruitment to this group. Sites will be notified when the restriction is lifted
- The participant's estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) is not below the lower limit of normal for the participant's age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants who are not expected to survive for more than 48 hours
- Participants who have had major thoracic or abdominal surgery in the 6 weeks prior to randomization
- Participants who have a known or suspected immunodeficiency (except immunoglobulin A [IgA] deficiency), such as a known human immunodeficiency virus infection
- Participants being treated with extracorporeal membrane oxygenation
- Participant receiving chronic oxygen therapy at home prior to admission
- Participants who have a poorly functioning gastrointestinal tract (that is, unable to absorb drugs or nutrition via enteral route)
